pull.title: Change linux gitian.sigs dir names to match windows
pull.body:
At the moment, linux sigs are marked with just the version, while windows sigs are marked with the version with -win appended. I don't see any reason why this should be the case. The logic is the same as renaming gitian.yml to gitian-linux.yml.

Also, this fixes an unbalanced paranthesis.

events.body:
NACK.  (if I may)

As I understand it that line builds all of them. Not just linux. There is a comment about 3 lines up that says that but I agree the script it is calling is misleadingly named.

@int03h Uh, I'm not sure exactly what you're saying. Have you ever done a gitian build? The gsign script signs whatever was just built. Right now, Linux and Windows builds are done separately. You can tell by the names of the descriptors. Right now the $VERSION-win dir is the signature for the Windows build, and $VERSION is the Linux build. This just makes it clear.
Makes sense, I suppose. This is too late for 0.9 but this convention can be used for the next release.

...I must have been tired or distracted or something, not everything's properly changed, etc.

I'll redo this.
@laanwj What defines "too late" in this case? Why couldn't this go into 0.9.0, if we end up needing an rc3?
ack and bump. Looking at it again I see why now. Sorry my fault for holding it wrong.
Okay, I think it's rebased now.

events.message:
Change linux gitian.sigs dir names to match windows

At the moment, linux sigs are marked with just the version, while windows sigs are marked with the version with -win appended. I don't see any reason why this should be the case. The logic is the same as renaming gitian.yml to gitian-linux.yml.

Also, this fixes an unbalanced paranthesis and a couple capitalization
things.
